visits.text: Wat Ek Phnom (Khmer ruins)

Discovery of Secret Lake and Phnom Chhnork temple
Observation of Trauey Kaoh salt marshes and Wat Trauey Kaoh pagoda
Excursion to Kep: crab market, Wat Samathi Pagoda and Kep National Park

activities.text: Journey to Kampot (ferry + bus)

visits.text: Royal Palace & Silver Pagoda (proper attire required)
National Museum of Cambodia (Khmer collections)
Tuol Sleng Genocide Museum (S-21)
Choeung Ek Memorial (Killing Fields)
Wat Phnom
Free time in Phnom Penh (catch up on museums/waterfront as desired)
Overview of the capital from the airport road and the banks of the Tonlé Sap/Mekong (Sisowath Quay)
Royal Palace (exteriors and gardens, including Silver Pagoda)
Wat Phnom and stupa (sacred hill founding the city)
Central Market (Phsar Thmey) with Art Deco architecture
Colonial architecture circuit (central post office, 1932 train station)
Chaktomuk Hall (Vann Molyvann) and Olympic Stadium (exteriors)
Tuol Sleng S-21 Genocide Museum (French audioguide)
SOSORO Currency Museum (economic history of Cambodia)
National Museum of Cambodia (pre-Angkorian and Angkorian collections)
Royal Palace complex (throne room, Silver Pagoda – exteriors)
Final free visits depending on flight (Mekong riverbanks, markets)
Tuol Sleng Genocide Museum
Wat Phnom and colonial buildings of the city center
Stroll along the Mekong riverbanks and visit to the Old Market and Night Market
Visit to the Royal Palace and the Silver Pagoda
Discovery of the Central Market and the Independence Monument
Visit to Wat Ounalom and participation in a Khmer boxing match at Bayon studio

activities.text: Stroll along Sisowath Quay
Sunset cruise on the Mekong & Tonlé Sap
Central Market (Phsar Thmei)
Russian Market (Tuol Tom Poung)
Last stroll on the Mekong or night market
Sunset cruise on the Tonlé Sap river (departure near Sisowath Quay)
Walking orientation tour along the quays and central streets
Electric tuk-tuk transportation for urban mini-safaris and photo stops
Evening stroll along the riverfront (Tonle Sap/Mekong)
Return transfer to town after boat Koh Rong → Sihanoukville and road to Phnom Penh

visits.text: Journey Battambang → Siem Reap via the Sangker River & Tonle Sap (floating villages en route)
Sunrise over Angkor Wat
Angkor Thom — Bayon (Buddha faces)
Ta Prohm (temple overrun by jungle)
Banteay Srei (finely carved pink temple)
Preah Khan (large complex with galleries and libraries)
Sambor Prei Kuk (UNESCO-listed pre-Angkorian site, brick temples in the forest)
Arrival and orientation tour of Siem Reap (riverbanks, old French quarter – exteriors)
Roluos Group (Bakong, Preah Ko) – first capital of the Khmer Empire
Angkor Wat (galleries and major bas-reliefs)
South Gate of Angkor Thom and Bayon (monumental faces)
Baphuon (pyramid, terrace)
Ta Prohm (temple overgrown by kapok trees)
Beng Mealea (ruins in the heart of the jungle)
Banteay Srei (pink sandstone, delicate bas-reliefs)
Theam's Gallery (house-museum and art workshop)
Mechrey landing stage then floating village of Prek Toal (lakeside life, floating houses)
Prek Toal bird sanctuary (bird watching, season depends on water level)
Kulen Elephant Forest (ethical sanctuary; encounter and observation, no riding)
APOPO Visitor Center (deminers and TNT detection rats)
Phsar Leu Thom Tmey (big Upper Market, local life)
Satcha – craftsman incubator (workshops and know-how boutique)
Small Angkor circuit including Bayon, Ta Keo and Ta Prohm
Visit to the Lotus Silk Farm and discovery of lotus silk production
Discovery of Psaar Chas (old market) and the Night Market of Siem Reap
Grand circuit of Angkor with the temples Prè Rup, East Mebon and Ta Som
Visit to the Angkor botanical garden
Visit to the APOPO center and demonstration of mine detection rats
Discovery of Wat Bo and the Angkor National Museum
Sunrise over Angkor Wat and visit to the main temple
Ascent of Phnom Bakheng and visit to Baksei Chamkrong temple
Excursion to the floating village of Kampong Phluk and boat ride on Tonlé Sap

activities.text: Apsara dance show in the evening
Tuk-tuk transportation in Angkor park
Photo stop at the moats and gates of Angkor Thom
Photo transect nature & heritage between Kampong Thom and Siem Reap
Sunset in the Angkor area (authorized viewpoint)
Country route between temples and villages (roadside craft stops)
Discovery of a cooperative workshop weaving water hyacinth (solidarity crafts)
Traditional boat trip on canals and lake (round trip)
Phare Ponleu Selpak circus show (evening)
